articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's strikes on Israel are self-defense and are "proportionate defensive operations directed exclusively at military objectives and associated infrastructure," Iran's U.N. Ambassador Amir Saeid Iravani told the U.N. Nations Security Council on Monday.
articles.title: Iran tells UN strikes on Israel are self-defense

articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Before leaving for the world leaders summit, U.S. President Donald Trump said, "I hope there's going to be a deal."
articles.title: Israel-Iran battle escalates, will be high on agenda as world leaders meet

articles.author: David Ljunggren, John Irish, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Leaders from the Group of Seven nations began annual talks on Monday with wars in Ukraine and the Middle East adding to global economic uncertainty, as host Canada tries to avoid a clash with U.S. President Donald Trump.
articles.title: G7 leaders aim for unity, facing escalating wars in Ukraine, Middle East

articles.author: Nathan Layne
articles.description: A man accused of killing a Democratic state lawmaker while posing as a police officer is expected to appear in a Minnesota court on Monday afternoon on state murder charges, after a massive two-day manhunt ended with his arrest on Sunday night.
articles.title: Suspect in Minnesota lawmaker killing to appear in court on murder charges

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The U.S. military has moved a large number of refueling aircraft to Europe to provide options to President Donald Trump as Middle East tensions erupt into conflict between Iran and Israel, two U.S. officials told Reuters on Monday, speaking on condition of anonymity.
articles.title: Exclusive: US bolsters Trump's Middle East military options by moving refueling aircraft, officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine received another 1,245 bodies of its soldiers killed in the war with Russia on Monday in the final stage of the repatriation of remains agreed at talks in Istanbul, Ukrainian officials said.
articles.title: Ukraine says repatriation of war dead over after 1,245 more bodies received from Russia

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, Samia Nakhoul, Andrew Mills
articles.description: Tehran has asked Qatar, Saudi Arabia and Oman to press U.S. President Donald Trump to use his influence on Israel to agree to an immediate ceasefire with Iran in return for Iranian flexibility in nuclear negotiations, two Iranian and three regional sources told Reuters on Monday.
articles.title: Iran sought US pressure on Israel for ceasefire via Gulf states, sources say

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: Lawyers for Harvard University urged a federal judge on Monday to extend an order blocking President Donald Trump's plan to bar foreign nationals from entering the United States to study at Harvard University.
articles.title: Harvard urges judge to bar Trump from closing doors for international students

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Hatem Khaled
articles.description: Israeli fire killed at least 40 people, half of them near an aid distribution site operated by the U.S.-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation on Monday, the territory's health ministry said, as U.N. officials denounced Israeli-backed aid delivery methods.
articles.title: 40 killed in Gaza, many trying to reach food, as UN denounces Israeli-backed aid system

articles.author: Julia Cobb
articles.description:
Colombian Senator Miguel Uribe, who has been hospitalized since he was shot in the head earlier this month during a campaign event, has been transferred to emergency surgery for a brain bleed, the Santa Fe Foundation hospital said on Monday.
Uribe, 39, a potential presidential candidate, was shot in Bogota on June 7 during a rally.
"Patient Miguel Uribe Turbay required transfer to surgery a few minutes ago for an urgent neurological procedure, because of clinical evidence and imaging showing an acute inter-cerebral bleed," the hospital said in a statement.
The shooting, which was caught on video, has unnerved the nation which saw a streak of candidates assassinated in the 1980s and 1990s.
Three suspects, including a 15-year-old alleged to be the shooter, are in custody.
articles.title: Colombia senator Uribe in emergency surgery for brain bleed-hospital
